Seconds Clock
Cannot find system clock app.
Cannot launch system clock: try giving SecondsClock permission SET_ALARMS.
Go to system clock app
Touch this button to go to the device\'s default clock app.
Configure new widget
Touch this button to set the configuration for new widgets. To create a new widget, long press in an empty space in your home screen.
Configure existing widget

Touch this button to configure a widget that you have created previously: you will be sent back to your home screen and the first widget (from this app) that you touch will take you to the widget configure screen for that widget.
When you see your home screen, if necessary move to the appropriate page, and touch the widget that you want to configure.
Configure full screen clock
Touch this button to configure the full screen clock.
Run full screen clock
Touch this button to run the full screen clock.
Clock
1x1 seconds clock

This shows what the widget looks like. If there is currently no home screen widget, the size may not be correct because SecondsClock can\'t find out what size the widget would be: it will use an estimate for the size of a 1x1 widget. If you resize the widget on the home screen to a larger size, the widget will rearrange its layout to use a larger font size. The background pattern shows the effect of the widget background in case it is not transparent.
Long press here for help information.
This screen allows you to define the characteristics of the clock widget. A long press on any of the objects on this screen will bring up some help information about it.
Show time in widget
If this box is checked, the widget will display the time in locale-appropriate format.
Show time with seconds in widget
If this box is checked, the widget will display the time in locale-appropriate format including seconds. This will increase battery drain since the widget has to update itself every second.
Show abbreviated day name in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the locale-appropriate abbreviation for the day of the week.
Show full day name in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the locale-appropriate full name for the day of the week.
Show numeric date in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the locale-appropriate numeric date. If the numeric date is shown, the full date cannot be shown as well.
Show day of month in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the day of the month.
Show abbreviated month name in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the locale-appropriate abbreviation for the month.
Show full month name in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the locale-appropriate full name for the month.
Show year in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the (Gregorian) year.
Set widget background colour
Touch this button to show a colour chooser screen for the background colour of the widget.
Set widget text colour
Touch this button to show a colour chooser screen for the text colour of the widget.
Touch anywhere in this pane to select the saturation and value of the text colour of the widget.
Touch anywhere in this pane to select the saturation and value of the background colour of the widget.

This screen provides sliders to set the hue, red, green, blue, and opacity of the clock widget\'s background. You can also type in values for red, green, blue, and opacity or pick a colour from the map of saturation and value for a hue.

This screen provides sliders to set the hue, red, gree, and blue components of the colour of the clock widget\'s text. You can also type in values for red, green, and blue, or pick a colour from the map of saturation and value for a hue.
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the amount of red in the colour.
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the amount of green in the colour.
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the amount of blue in the colour.

Move the thumb on this slider to set the hue. This will not modify the value or saturation, which can be set by picking a colour from the map pane. Black, white and grayscale colours have a saturation of zero, so changing their hue will have no effect.
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the opacity of the widget background: zero is transparent and 255 is fully opaque.
Done
Touch this button or the back button to return to the main configuration screen.
This slider adjusts the size of the seconds. All the way to the left is no seconds at all. All the way to the right is the same size as the hours and minutes.
Touch this end of the slider for a clock with no seconds shown.
Touch in the middle of the slider for a clock with seconds shown at a smaller size.
Touch this end of the slider for a clock with seconds shown at the same size as the hours and minutes.
Simulate seven segment LED.
If you really want to waste your high resolution display simulating a seven segment LED clock, check this box.
